H0.text: Photosynthesis is the process that is affected when chewing insects mechanically damage plants and lessen the surface area of leaves.

H1.text: Vegetation is the result when chewing insects mechanically damage plants and lessen the surface area of leaves.

H2.text: Tissues are what is damaged by chewing insects that mechanically damage plants and reduce the surface area of leaves.

H3.text: Nutrients are what is affected when chewing insects mechanically damage plants and lessen the surface area of leaves.

A4.text: Plants can also be indirectly affected by herbivores through nutrient recycling, with plants benefiting from herbivores when nutrients are recycled very efficiently.

A5.text: This is released when the plant is damaged and inhibits cellular respiration and electron transport.
